fields.name: MAXMB
fields.description: Number Of The Last Message Buffer

enumeratedValues.name: one_full_ID
enumeratedValues.description: Format A: One full ID (standard and extended) per ID filter table element.

enumeratedValues.name: two_full_ID
enumeratedValues.description: Format B: Two full standard IDs or two partial 14-bit (standard and extended) IDs per ID filter table element.

enumeratedValues.name: four_partial_ID
enumeratedValues.description: Format C: Four partial 8-bit standard IDs per ID filter table element.

enumeratedValues.name: all_frames_rejected
enumeratedValues.description: Format D: All frames rejected.

enumeratedValues.name: CAN_FD_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: CAN FD is disabled. FlexCAN is able to receive and transmit messages in CAN 2.0 format.

enumeratedValues.name: CAN_FD_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: CAN FD is enabled. FlexCAN is able to receive and transmit messages in both CAN FD and CAN 2.0 formats.

enumeratedValues.name: abort_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: Abort disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: abort_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: Abort enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: local_priority_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: Local Priority disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: local_priority_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: Local Priority enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: id2
enumeratedValues.description: DMA feature for RX FIFO disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: id4
enumeratedValues.description: DMA feature for RX FIFO enabled.

fields.name: IRMQ
fields.description: Individual Rx Masking And Queue Enable

enumeratedValues.name: individual_rx_masking_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: Individual Rx masking and queue feature are disabled. For backward compatibility with legacy applications, the reading of C/S word locks the MB even if it is EMPTY.

enumeratedValues.name: individual_rx_masking_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: Individual Rx masking and queue feature are enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: self_reception_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: Self-reception enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: self_reception_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: Self-reception disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: low_power_doze_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: FlexCAN is not enabled to enter low-power mode when Doze mode is requested.

enumeratedValues.name: low_power_doze_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: FlexCAN is enabled to enter low-power mode when Doze mode is requested.

enumeratedValues.name: unfiltered_rx_input
enumeratedValues.description: FlexCAN uses the unfiltered Rx input to detect recessive to dominant edges on the CAN bus.

enumeratedValues.name: filtered_rx_input
enumeratedValues.description: FlexCAN uses the filtered Rx input to detect recessive to dominant edges on the CAN bus.

enumeratedValues.name: low_power_no
enumeratedValues.description: FlexCAN is not in a low-power mode.

enumeratedValues.name: low_power_yes
enumeratedValues.description: FlexCAN is in a low-power mode.

enumeratedValues.name: TWRNINT_RWRNINT_inactive
enumeratedValues.description: TWRNINT and RWRNINT bits are zero, independent of the values in the error counters.

enumeratedValues.name: TWRNINT_RWRNINT_active
enumeratedValues.description: TWRNINT and RWRNINT bits are set when the respective error counter transitions from less than 96 to greater than or equal to 96.

enumeratedValues.name: self_wakeup_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: FlexCAN Self Wake Up feature is disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: self_wakeup_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: FlexCAN Self Wake Up feature is enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: id2
enumeratedValues.description: FlexCAN is in User mode. Affected registers allow both Supervisor and Unrestricted accesses.

enumeratedValues.name: id4
enumeratedValues.description: FlexCAN is in Supervisor mode. Affected registers allow only Supervisor access. Unrestricted access behaves as though the access was done to an unimplemented register location.

enumeratedValues.name: freeze_mode_no
enumeratedValues.description: FlexCAN not in Freeze mode, prescaler running.

enumeratedValues.name: freeze_mode_yes
enumeratedValues.description: FlexCAN in Freeze mode, prescaler stopped.

enumeratedValues.name: SOFTRST_no_reset_request
enumeratedValues.description: No reset request.

enumeratedValues.name: SOFTRST_reset_registers
enumeratedValues.description: Resets the registers affected by soft reset.

enumeratedValues.name: wakeup_interrupt_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: Wake Up interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: wakeup_interrupt_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: Wake Up interrupt is enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: id1
enumeratedValues.description: FlexCAN module is either in Normal mode, Listen-Only mode, or Loop-Back mode.

enumeratedValues.name: id2
enumeratedValues.description: FlexCAN module is either in Disable mode, Doze mode, Stop mode, or Freeze mode.

enumeratedValues.name: HALT_disable
enumeratedValues.description: No Freeze mode request.

enumeratedValues.name: HALT_enable
enumeratedValues.description: Enters Freeze mode if the FRZ bit is asserted.

enumeratedValues.name: id2
enumeratedValues.description: Rx FIFO not enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: id4
enumeratedValues.description: Rx FIFO enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: freeze_mode_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: Not enabled to enter Freeze mode.

enumeratedValues.name: freeze_mode_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: Enabled to enter Freeze mode.

enumeratedValues.name: flexcan_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: Enable the FlexCAN module.

enumeratedValues.name: flexcan_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: Disable the FlexCAN module.

enumeratedValues.name: listen_only_mode_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: Listen-Only mode is deactivated.

enumeratedValues.name: listen_only_mode_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: FlexCAN module operates in Listen-Only mode.

enumeratedValues.name: highest_buffer_first
enumeratedValues.description: Buffer with highest priority is transmitted first.

enumeratedValues.name: lowest_buffer_first
enumeratedValues.description: Lowest number buffer is transmitted first.

enumeratedValues.name: timer_sync_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: Timer sync feature disabled

enumeratedValues.name: timer_sync_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: Timer sync feature enabled

enumeratedValues.name: auto_recover_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: Automatic recovering from Bus Off state enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: auto_recover_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: Automatic recovering from Bus Off state disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: one_sample
enumeratedValues.description: Just one sample is used to determine the bit value.

enumeratedValues.name: three_sample
enumeratedValues.description: Three samples are used to determine the value of the received bit: the regular one (sample point) and two preceding samples; a majority rule is used.

enumeratedValues.name: rx_warning_int_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: Rx Warning interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: rx_warning_int_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: Rx Warning interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: tx_warning_int_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: Tx Warning interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: tx_warning_int_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: Tx Warning interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: loopback_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: Loop Back disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: loopback_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: Loop Back enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: error_int_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: Error interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: error_int_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: Error interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: bus_off_int_disabled
enumeratedValues.description: Bus Off interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: bus_off_int_enabled
enumeratedValues.description: Bus Off interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValues.description: Indicates setting of any error bit detected in the data phase of CAN FD frames with the BRS bit set.

enumeratedValues.name: overrun_occurred
enumeratedValues.description: Overrun has occurred.

enumeratedValues.description: No such occurrence.

enumeratedValues.name: bit0_error_yes

fields.name: BUF0I
fields.description: Buffer MB0 Interrupt Or Clear FIFO bit

enumeratedValues.name: buffer_Tx_Rx_not_complete
enumeratedValues.description: The corresponding buffer has no occurrence of successfully completed transmission or reception when MCR[RFEN]=0.

enumeratedValues.name: buffer_Tx_Rx_complete
enumeratedValues.description: The corresponding buffer has successfully completed transmission or reception when MCR[RFEN]=0.

fields.name: BUF5I
fields.description: Buffer MB5 Interrupt Or Frames available in Rx FIFO

enumeratedValues.name: id2
enumeratedValues.description: No occurrence of MB5 completing transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or of frame(s) available in the FIFO, when MCR[RFEN]=1

enumeratedValues.name: id4
enumeratedValues.description: MB5 completed transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or frame(s) available in the Rx FIFO when MCR[RFEN]=1. It generates a DMA request in case of MCR[RFEN] and MCR[DMA] are enabled.

fields.name: BUF6I
fields.description: Buffer MB6 Interrupt Or Rx FIFO Warning

enumeratedValues.name: id2
enumeratedValues.description: No occurrence of MB6 completing transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or of Rx FIFO almost full when MCR[RFEN]=1

enumeratedValues.name: id4
enumeratedValues.description: MB6 completed transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or Rx FIFO almost full when MCR[RFEN]=1

fields.name: BUF7I
fields.description: Buffer MB7 Interrupt Or Rx FIFO Overflow

enumeratedValues.name: id2
enumeratedValues.description: No occurrence of MB7 completing transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or of Rx FIFO overflow when MCR[RFEN]=1

enumeratedValues.name: id4
enumeratedValues.description: MB7 completed transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or Rx FIFO overflow when MCR[RFEN]=1

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Edge filter is enabled

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Edge filter is disabled

enumeratedValues.name: non_ISO
enumeratedValues.description: FlexCAN operates using the non-ISO CAN FD protocol.

enumeratedValues.name: ISO
enumeratedValues.description: FlexCAN operates using the ISO CAN FD protocol (ISO 11898-1).

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Protocol exception is disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Protocol exception is enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: CAN_bit_clock
enumeratedValues.description: The free running timer is clocked by the CAN bit clock, which defines the baud rate on the CAN bus.

enumeratedValues.name: external_clock
enumeratedValues.description: The free running timer is clocked by an external time tick. The period can be either adjusted to be equal to the baud rate on the CAN bus, or a different value as required. See the device-specific section for details about the external time tick.

fields.name: EACEN
fields.description: Entire Frame Arbitration Field Comparison Enable For Rx Mailboxes

enumeratedValues.name: RTR_compare_no
enumeratedValues.description: Rx mailbox filter's IDE bit is always compared and RTR is never compared despite mask bits.

enumeratedValues.name: RTR_compare_yes
enumeratedValues.description: Enables the comparison of both Rx mailbox filter's IDE and RTR bit with their corresponding bits within the incoming frame. Mask bits do apply.

enumeratedValues.name: remote_response_frame_not_generated
enumeratedValues.description: Remote response frame is generated.

enumeratedValues.name: remote_response_frame_generated
enumeratedValues.description: Remote request frame is stored.

enumeratedValues.name: id2
enumeratedValues.description: Matching starts from Rx FIFO and continues on mailboxes.

enumeratedValues.name: id4
enumeratedValues.description: Matching starts from mailboxes and continues on Rx FIFO.

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Bus off done interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Bus off done interrupt enabled.

fields.name: ERRMSK_FAST
fields.description: Error Interrupt Mask for errors detected in the data phase of fast CAN FD frames

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValues.description: ERRINT_FAST error interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValues.description: ERRINT_FAST error interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: inactive_mailbox_no
enumeratedValues.description: If ESR2[VPS] is asserted, the ESR2[LPTM] is not an inactive mailbox.

enumeratedValues.name: inactive_mailbox_yes
enumeratedValues.description: If ESR2[VPS] is asserted, there is at least one inactive mailbox. LPTM content is the number of the first one.

enumeratedValues.name: invalid
enumeratedValues.description: Contents of IMB and LPTM are invalid.

enumeratedValues.name: valid
enumeratedValues.description: Contents of IMB and LPTM are valid.

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Extended bit time definitions disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Extended bit time definitions enabled.

fields.name: TIME_STAMP
fields.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

fields.name: DLC
fields.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

fields.name: RTR
fields.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

fields.name: IDE
fields.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

fields.name: SRR
fields.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

fields.name: CODE
fields.description: Message Buffer Code. This 4-bit field can be accessed (read or write) by the CPU and by the FlexCAN module itself, as part of the message buffer matching and arbitration process.

fields.name: ESI
fields.description: Error State Indicator. This bit indicates if the transmitting node is error active or error passive.

fields.name: BRS
fields.description: Bit Rate Switch. This bit defines whether the bit rate is switched inside a CAN FD format frame.

fields.name: EDL
fields.description: Extended Data Length. This bit distinguishes between CAN format and CAN FD format frames. The EDL bit must not be set for Message Buffers configured to RANSWER with code field 0b1010.

fields.name: BRS
fields.description: Bit Rate Switch. This bit defines whether the bit rate is switched inside a CAN FD format frame.

fields.name: EDL
fields.description: Extended Data Length. This bit distinguishes between CAN format and CAN FD format frames. The EDL bit must not be set for Message Buffers configured to RANSWER with code field 0b1010.

fields.name: TIME_STAMP
fields.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

fields.name: DLC
fields.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

fields.name: RTR
fields.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

fields.name: IDE
fields.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

fields.name: SRR
fields.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

fields.name: CODE
fields.description: Message Buffer Code. This 4-bit field can be accessed (read or write) by the CPU and by the FlexCAN module itself, as part of the message buffer matching and arbitration process.

fields.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

fields.name: STD
fields.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

fields.name: PRIO
fields.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

fields.description: Extended Data Length. This bit distinguishes between CAN format and CAN FD format frames. The EDL bit must not be set for Message Buffers configured to RANSWER with code field 0b1010.

fields.name: TIME_STAMP
fields.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

fields.description: Error State Indicator. This bit indicates if the transmitting node is error active or error passive.

fields.name: BRS
fields.description: Bit Rate Switch. This bit defines whether the bit rate is switched inside a CAN FD format frame.

fields.name: EDL
fields.description: Extended Data Length. This bit distinguishes between CAN format and CAN FD format frames. The EDL bit must not be set for Message Buffers configured to RANSWER with code field 0b1010.

fields.name: EXT
fields.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

fields.name: STD
fields.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

fields.name: PRIO
fields.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

fields.name: EXT
fields.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

fields.name: STD
fields.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

fields.name: PRIO
fields.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

fields.name: TIME_STAMP
fields.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

fields.name: DLC
fields.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

fields.name: RTR
fields.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

fields.name: IDE
fields.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

fields.name: SRR
fields.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

fields.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

fields.name: CODE
fields.description: Message Buffer Code. This 4-bit field can be accessed (read or write) by the CPU and by the FlexCAN module itself, as part of the message buffer matching and arbitration process.

fields.name: ESI
fields.description: Error State Indicator. This bit indicates if the transmitting node is error active or error passive.

fields.name: BRS
fields.description: Bit Rate Switch. This bit defines whether the bit rate is switched inside a CAN FD format frame.

fields.name: EDL
fields.description: Extended Data Length. This bit distinguishes between CAN format and CAN FD format frames. The EDL bit must not be set for Message Buffers configured to RANSWER with code field 0b1010.

fields.name: EXT
fields.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

fields.name: STD
fields.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

fields.name: PRIO
fields.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

fields.name: TIME_STAMP
fields.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

fields.name: DLC
fields.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

fields.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

fields.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

fields.name: TIME_STAMP
fields.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

fields.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

fields.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

fields.name: SRR
fields.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

fields.description: Error State Indicator. This bit indicates if the transmitting node is error active or error passive.

fields.name: BRS
fields.description: Bit Rate Switch. This bit defines whether the bit rate is switched inside a CAN FD format frame.

fields.name: EDL
fields.description: Extended Data Length. This bit distinguishes between CAN format and CAN FD format frames. The EDL bit must not be set for Message Buffers configured to RANSWER with code field 0b1010.

fields.name: TIME_STAMP
fields.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

fields.name: DLC
fields.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

fields.name: RTR
fields.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

fields.name: IDE
fields.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

fields.name: SRR
fields.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

fields.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

fields.name: STD
fields.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

fields.name: PRIO
fields.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

fields.description: Bit Rate Switch. This bit defines whether the bit rate is switched inside a CAN FD format frame.

fields.name: EDL
fields.description: Extended Data Length. This bit distinguishes between CAN format and CAN FD format frames. The EDL bit must not be set for Message Buffers configured to RANSWER with code field 0b1010.

fields.name: EXT
fields.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

fields.name: STD
fields.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

fields.name: PRIO
fields.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

fields.description: Extended Data Length. This bit distinguishes between CAN format and CAN FD format frames. The EDL bit must not be set for Message Buffers configured to RANSWER with code field 0b1010.

fields.name: EXT
fields.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

fields.name: STD
fields.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

fields.name: PRIO
fields.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

fields.name: TIME_STAMP
fields.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

fields.name: DLC
fields.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

fields.name: RTR
fields.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

fields.name: IDE
fields.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

fields.name: SRR
fields.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

fields.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

fields.name: DLC
fields.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

fields.name: RTR
fields.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

fields.name: IDE
fields.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

fields.name: SRR
fields.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

fields.name: CODE
fields.description: Message Buffer Code. This 4-bit field can be accessed (read or write) by the CPU and by the FlexCAN module itself, as part of the message buffer matching and arbitration process.

fields.name: ESI
fields.description: Error State Indicator. This bit indicates if the transmitting node is error active or error passive.

fields.name: BRS
fields.description: Bit Rate Switch. This bit defines whether the bit rate is switched inside a CAN FD format frame.

fields.name: EDL
fields.description: Extended Data Length. This bit distinguishes between CAN format and CAN FD format frames. The EDL bit must not be set for Message Buffers configured to RANSWER with code field 0b1010.

fields.name: EXT
fields.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

fields.name: STD
fields.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

fields.name: PRIO
fields.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

enumeratedValues.name: in_range
enumeratedValues.description: Measured loop delay is in range.

enumeratedValues.name: out_of_range
enumeratedValues.description: Measured loop delay is out of range.

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValues.description: TDC is disabled

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValues.description: TDC is enabled

fields.name: MBDSR0
fields.description: Message Buffer Data Size for Region 0

enumeratedValues.name: R0_8_bytes
enumeratedValues.description: Selects 8 bytes per message buffer.

enumeratedValues.name: R0_16_bytes
enumeratedValues.description: Selects 16 bytes per message buffer.

enumeratedValues.name: R0_32_bytes
enumeratedValues.description: Selects 32 bytes per message buffer.

enumeratedValues.name: R0_64_bytes
enumeratedValues.description: Selects 64 bytes per message buffer.

fields.name: MBDSR1
fields.description: Message Buffer Data Size for Region 1

enumeratedValues.name: R1_8_bytes
enumeratedValues.description: Selects 8 bytes per message buffer.

enumeratedValues.name: R1_16_bytes
enumeratedValues.description: Selects 16 bytes per message buffer.

enumeratedValues.name: R1_32_bytes
enumeratedValues.description: Selects 32 bytes per message buffer.

enumeratedValues.name: R1_64_bytes
enumeratedValues.description: Selects 64 bytes per message buffer.

enumeratedValues.name: nominal
enumeratedValues.description: Transmit a frame in nominal rate. The BRS bit in the Tx MB has no effect.

enumeratedValues.name: bit_rate_switching
enumeratedValues.description: Transmit a frame with bit rate switching if the BRS bit in the Tx MB is recessive.
